critique: This document pertains to the post-Civil War Reconstruction era. It outlines the reorganization of military districts following the readmission of Virginia's representatives to Congress. The order establishes the Department of Virginia, encompassing Maryland, Virginia, West Virginia, and North Carolina, under the command of General Canby. It also directs the reporting of commanding officers and the relocation of specific infantry companies. Given the historical context, the document reflects a period of federal oversight in the South to ensure compliance with Reconstruction policies.
